brief_summary.textblock:
To investigate the impact of impaired renal function on the pharmacokinetics of ART-123 in
      patients with Disseminated Intravascular Coagulation.

      To investigate the safety of ART-123 in patients with Disseminated Intravascular
      Coagulation.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Pharmacokinetics Study of ART-123 in Disseminated Intravascular Coagulation (DIC) Subjects With Renal Impairment

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Japanese Association for Acute Medicine-defined DIC criteria score >= 4

          -  Written informed consent from patient or guardian

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Patients showing intracranial, pulmonary, gastrointestinal hemorrhage

          -  Patients with a history of cerebrovascular disorders within the past 52 week

          -  Patients with a history of hypersensitivity to the ingredients of ART-123
             preparations

          -  Pregnant women, nursing mothers or possibly pregnant women

intervention.description: 380 U/kg/day or 130 U/kg/day(Subjects with severe renal impairment) for 6 days

clinical_study.official_title: A Post-Marketing Clinical Pharmacokinetics Study of ART-123 in DIC Subjects With Renal Impairment

oversight_info.authority: Japan: Pharmaceuticals and Medical Devices Agency

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence rate of hemorrhage related adverse events
primary_outcome.time_frame: from the start of infusion to 8days after the cessation of infusion

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Non-Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Pharmacokinetics Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
